results.title: Effective resumes: resumes for maximum impact
results.creator_credit: Robert Richardson Jr, Susan Richardson and Riverside Productions
results.brief_description: This American video addresses the need for every job seeker (in particular young people), to have a resume and methods for laying it out, presentation and content. It presents tips for achieving an edge over other applicants.

results.title: Film technique: editing. Parts 1 and 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Explains the editor’s responsibilities and summarises the various stages of editing. The first part deals mainly with the editing of silent films. The second part is more complex and discusses the editing of film with sound and synchronising sound and picture. Intended for film and TV trainees and technical colleges.
results.description:

results.title: Acting
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Shows a stage actor during audition and his transition to a motion picture actor. Well known actors including Helen Hayes, Vincent Price, Henry Fonda, Jim Backus, Jean Stapleton, Jeff Corey, Royal Dano, Mariette Hartley, Janet McLachlan and Paul Newman appear and discuss problem areas that a film actor must deal with.

results.title: Camera
results.creator_credit: Bruce A. Block, Tim Barr and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Uses interviews with cinematographers including Lazlo Kovacs, Lee Garmes and James Crabe to explain the major points of motion picture photography and cameras. Defines and explains many techniques including dolly shots, lenses, camera movement, film speeds and camera focus.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce A. Block, Tim Barr and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.description:

results.title: Edward John Eyre
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, Bern Gandy and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film covers the route which Edward John Eyre explored in 1840 between Adelaide, South Australia, and Albany, Western Australia. Illustrates scenes along this route which skirts the Nullabor Plain and is now known as the Eyre Highway; Adelaide as it was when he left is reproduced from old drawings and contrasted with the Adelaide of today; Whyalla with its shipbuilding and iron industry; Eucla, deserted gold mining town, Coolgardie and Kalgoorlie; present-day Perth, now a big city.

results.title: Overview of 8mm production
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
This film introduces the student to a general background on the making of 8mm films. Attention is given to the kinds of equipment required, the use of camera and film editing.

results.title: Patsy Adam-Smith: author and social historian
results.creator_credit: Catherine South, Janet McLeod and Women's Program of the AFC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian women’s archival Series”.
An archival interview in which Patsy tells of her childhood, the inspirations for her books, her philosophy on oral history, her working methods, the adventure of her life at sea and her thoughts on love, children and marriage. Most of her books focus on the lives of ‘ordinary’ Australian working people, uncovering the unique history, folklore and lifestyle - the ‘real’ history of Australia, often lost in the overview of traditional history. Tagged as an ‘unconventional woman’, Patsy ignored the social rules of her day, and blithely worked in, sought out and wrote about the worlds in which women traditionally had no place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Catherine South, Janet McLeod and Women’s Program of the AFC

results.title: Editing
results.creator_credit: Bruce A. Block, Tim Barr and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Film making techniques”.
Discusses the processes of film editing from the preparation of the work print to the completion of a finished, edited film. Explains the processes of setting up the editing bench, rewinding, using the moviescope, splicing, breaking-down the work print, marking, adding dialogue and using the moviola.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bruce A. Block, Tim Barr and AIMS Instructional Media

results.title: Efftee Entertainers
results.brief_description: For the first time on video - the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films - all transferred directly from quality original 35mm nitrate negatives and prints. Filmed on state-of-the-art Mitchell cameras with RCA sound, these long forgotten, `shorts’ open a window on the Australian Variety and Show world of the early 1930s.
results.description: For the first time on video - the earliest Australian stage acts to appear on sound films - all transferred directly from quality original 35mm nitrate negatives and prints.
